revised_title: Pressure-Solution and Crystallization Deformation in Geological Structures
tldr: The article discusses pressure-solution and crystallization deformation in geological structures, focusing on the role of diffusion processes in the rearrangement of minerals. The author examines the thermodynamics of crystal-solution systems and the different types of geological processes involved, such as pressure-solution, cavity growth, pressure growth, and solution-transfer. The study aims to provide a better understanding of the strains and displacements associated with these processes in rocks.
